intro: Ophrys rosea, commonly known as the rose orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, with a single, showy flower that resembles a female bee, a feature that plays a key role in its pollination strategy. The plant produces a single, erect, pinkish-purple flower with a short, hairy spur. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Ophrys rosea is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters.
